title: How to Tie Yourself up in a Spreadeagle Position

steps.headline: Tie the ropes/lock the chains/cuffs to the four posts.
steps.description: If you're using the variant with three chains and one rope, position the rope where your main hand will be.

steps.headline: Tie your legs to the two lower posts as tight as you want them.
steps.description: Don't use a slipknot, as it might get really tight as you struggle, which might stop your blood flow. Remember that if you spread your legs too much it might get very uncomfortable over time.

steps.headline: Tie a slipknot on the rope that will hold your main hand, but don't put the hand in yet.
Tie your other hand to the corresponding post.
Get your last hand into the slipknot and pull it tight.
steps.description: If you position the knot itself behind your palm, it will be nearly impossible to escape by yourself. Of course, a handcuff is easier to use but not everyone has one.

Tie your other hand to the corresponding post.  Get your last hand into the slipknot and pull it tight.
